metadata.title: French Streamer Jean Pormanove Dies During Livestream as Nice Prosecutor Orders Autopsy

left: Jean Pormanove, a French social media star, was found dead after enduring '10 days of torture, sleep deprivation and ingestion of toxic products'.
Clara Chappaz, France’s Minister Delegate for Artificial Intelligence, reported that Pormanove was 'humiliated and mistreated for months live on the Kick platform'.
Kick's community rules aim to protect creators, and the platform expressed commitment to enforcing them.
An inquiry has been opened by a Nice prosecutor following the circumstances of Pormanove's death.
center: Jean Pormanove, a French social media star, was found dead after enduring '10 days of torture, sleep deprivation and ingestion of toxic products'.
Clara Chappaz, France’s Minister Delegate for Artificial Intelligence, reported that Pormanove was 'humiliated and mistreated for months live on the Kick platform'.
Kick's community rules aim to protect creators, and the platform expressed commitment to enforcing them.
An inquiry has been opened by a Nice prosecutor following the circumstances of Pormanove's death.
right: Raphael Graven, known for extreme challenges, died at 46 during a livestream at his home in France.
French government minister Clara Chappaz described the violence Graven faced during livestreams as an 'absolute horror.'
Kick is reviewing the circumstances of Graven's death and its community guidelines, noting it prohibits self-harm or excessive violence.
The Nice prosecutor's office began an investigation into Graven's death and ordered an autopsy, noting 'nothing suspicious' so far.
